string.text: Local folklore

So we’re creeping into this hangar, right. Dust, spider web everywhere, mad filthy; detectors going bunk: like not only do they sense nothing, but as if we are even non-existent. So we’re getting into positions along the perimeter: Sanyok leading the way, the rest covering behind… then all of a sudden: WHAMMO! There were these huge iron joists rusting under the ceiling, so one of them breaks off and goes plummeting down on the floor! Somehow, Sanyok managed to dodge, and this shit thrusts into the floor right where he had been standing. Well, Sanyok flops down, rolls over, doesn’t even get up to his feet anymore and, still there on the floor, just goes blasting away! We all freak out and start off firing like crazy. Then Sanoyk starts screaming blue murder something about some creature in the corner. I look over there, and don’t see a thing… So you get it, right, not an operation, but total clusterfuck… clustero-fucko… So we go looking around the ruins; for about five minutes, walking wide, making sure we don’t get under any joists. And it was really creepy, man, one after another sees something and lets fly half a jet at sweet Fanny Adams. Two of our guys got screwed altogether: one tripped into a pit all of a sudden, another got bashed by the door that flies off its hinges. Now we really get worked up, it’s flat and plain some bitch is fucking with us! So we spark off our psy-protection, toss a gas grenade in each corner and hold off to see who buzzes in, fingers on triggers. So we’re waiting, and waiting… Turns out the motherfucker was flying or something like that… So while we were all fooling around on the floor it was lying doggo on the ceiling and having itself a ball… It dawned on us too late, and by pure accident. That piece of shit shook loose some more joists, so half the roof crashes down to the floor, dead right on us, four of our guys squashed flat right there… And then we got that son of a bitch! As soon as Sanyok heard it rustling on the ceiling, he blazed away by reflex – a damn good reflex, I must tell you! You should’ve heard that thing yelping! We all jump up fogging away with every gun… That bitch tumbled down squalling so loud we had our ears dinned. Man, we gave that thing hell, clubbing and kicking, and Sanyok, he flicked out his knife to slit that thing’s bowels… Well, the commander, dragged us all off, otherwise we’d have to spoon this motherfucker off the floor…

Have you heard about the Pathfinder? The very first of all stalkers. He was the one who broke in the Zone, and still alive. People say he can take you anywhere, you name it. Now, finding him’s a bit tricky, he ain’t got posters around with his address… And he don’t go with just anybody, either. From what I hear he charges quite a bit of greenbacks, but if you find him and agree on the price, you can rest assured, he’ll take you where you need to in spades. Now, that’s someone I’d like to shmooze with. He sure has been past the radar…
Super pathfinder

Now flossing and having chalupa, that’s two big differences… You think moolah is easy to get? No fucking way! For buckshee you only cop it here with some fugly or get pipped by a stalker… You’ve got to use your noddle. You’ve got to use your noddle over there, and even better over here. Roughnecks don’t last long around here. It just won’t click if you have rats in the attic… Anyway, here’s how it was. The three of us, the late Bruise and Loop, were trailing across the farmstead, to take a shortcut. All of a sudden we see some bloke hotfooting our way. So we fuzz out. The bloke is walking right by us totally looking over. He was a really bantam type of fellow, and hauling this huge sack along. The subgun hanging at the ready, we’d be stuffed with olives at the drop of a hat. So Bruise says to me, why don’t we shake this snip down, see what he’s got over there? And I says, quiet you moron, watch where he’s about to stow away his swag! … Well.. Suddenly, the bloke vanishes into thin air, and we didn’t see a damn thing! Alright, so we sit and wait. He pops up in ‘bout 20 minutes. And while he’s standing there, shaking off dust, Loop sneaks up behind and blasts half his head off with his gat. So him and Bruise start frisking this guy, he had a royal armor vest, and a fanny pack, too… I had to piss so I walked off, I knew my guys would always give me my share, I’m always in. All of a sudden I hear KABOOM!.. Turns out that nerd had his vest all wired so it would blow up if someone tried to take it off. I buzzed off right away, who knows who’s gonna show up for the gun shot and the explosion… Went back there a month later. Not a bone left of Loop, Bruise and that bloke. Nada. So I reckoned where he could’ve dived into the ruins, and crawled in there myself… Passed three rooms, zilch! Suddenly I see a bunch of beds piled up in one corner. What the heck are they all doing there? Started taking them apart. And what do I see in there? Holy cats, a hatch! So I lift it up and turn on my flashlight. Good grief, I’m in heaven!.. Well, what I saw there is my business… I didn’t come off the loser. But think of it, had I dragged my feet, I would’ve been dead already or running around barefoot and slobbering, as some do…
The hatch into heaven.

They say there’s this one gang here… People call them shamans or Druids. So it appears they don’t use any electronic equipment at all, say they want to keep close to the nature and stuff… Well, they reason the Zone reacts stronger to equipment… to all this electromagnetic radiation or something… and attracts monsters. If you listen to them the Zone is like a living being. Like, it’s no good going into it with all these gadgets, if you’re right in your mind you’ll get by fine without ‘em. They do schlep subguns, though… Not giving it a chance with teeth and nails, eh… But then again, I don’t hear a lot of them popping off in the Zone. Well, at least no more than us… So maybe they are on the right track there… They seem to be coming more from the belarusian side, though… I’d like to have a look at them… and check out their pockets, too, for some artifacts…
The story of the battle druids.

Does anybody know the score on these top secret labs deep in the Zone?.. They’re still functioning, aren’t they… Well, yeah… How the heck does anybody manage to survive there at all… without any food or energy… So the question is: what if it’s not even people working there? I talked to this one kipper… He didn’t see those labs himself… …No, he didn’t see them with his own eyes, but his scanner tapped some weird talks at “Yantar”. They were talking about some laboratory. And the other guy was swearing to the first one that he had run into this figure dressed in an outfit similar to what stalkers wear, but much fancier… And this translucent figure as if told him to piss off. Something like, be gone, we’re working here. Scared the shit out him, I’m telling you! I mean, have you seen anything like that before?.. But on the other hand, it all sort of happened not far from the radar… You know what I mean… Right. So it probably ain’t true… But then again… mutations, they take different forms, right? So, maybe those are not people any more, but some sort of energetic entities? Could be, eh?.. C’mon, what are you laughing at… Cracking up over nothing…
The shadow of a ghost.

Here’s what I’ll tell you. You almost can’t sleep at all in this part of the Zone… I’m in luck, I can’t sleep anyway… but the nightmares people see, sometimes they don’t wake up in the morning… rupture of the heart, for example… Some fly off the handle, some go loco… But a rumor has gone abroad that there’s actually one cure. If you really have an urge to sleep, you should find an old bucket… a big pot will do… a caldron or something… As long as it has no holes… Stick your head in there and have a good night and sweet repose… There now, you may laugh all you want. I’ll see you in a couple of days when you are ready to drop dread from exhaustion. Smartalecs… So tell me, what the heck are the war dogs roaming about sporting these fancy helmets now, eh? Well yeah! For about two years neither hide nor hair, and now they’re all over the place! And the brain buckets are something new; someone found the body of one such war dog, they’ve seen it. There’s a mesh inside, made of thin copper wire, attached to the liner. What the hell is it doing there? Mark my words, there’s something strange behind all this mumbo-jumbo. This place is useless in terms of anomalies, these are not the grounds for those, other areas are safer and with much better swag in store… So I reckon they’re researching the grounds. Marking the area for their base. They want to get through to the Sarcophagus, I’m telling you… What we should do is try and stay as far away as possible from them when the moment comes…
Nightmare without a bucket.

Hey, man, is anybody aware of “Interception”? Rumor has it they’re real pros, all cadre! But you should see them work! The things they do! Nothing like those buggers at cordons! Not only do they go into every stinking hellhole, they stay in the Zone for months on end! No bullshit! They’ve got bases, and many of them, and a nice bit of hideouts, and right by the perimeter choppers throw in some food for them. Their commander is some guy named Gromov… now I reckon the name’s fake, they call him “Major” or “Grom”. You don’t believe me?! Pakhomych tapped them once! He tapped and buzzed off, or he’d get pipped right there and then… Secrecy, damn it! Ya’ll know Pakhomych, don’t you? That’s it! So they’re not some load of crap, but a royal squad. What the heck are they doing here? But bloody hell to they get some swag! If I could just get one third, no, at least ten per cent of that! I’d already have a ten-storeyed mansion in Sochi and live in clover… They say they’ve got this one gadget… detects monsters within two hundred yards. Any stinking creature! If I only had this thing I’d been picnicking left and right in the Zone… And you know what else they say, there are some other chaps… Not war dogs, but sort of like stalkers… Anyway, some of them got through to the center of the Zone. And not only did they get there safe and sound, but they say they can tame them beasts! They never even go past the perimeter, to the Big Land, and no one ever goes to them… well, except maybe those who’re destined to reach the Sarcophagus… And some artifacts they’ve got, too!.. “Duty” know about them alright… those slimeballs, they know and fight, but won’t leak a word! You try asking one of those cops, and they just say “Horse-feathers!” Some bitches, eh?
Interception, the interior inhabitant.

Brothers, did you hear that several disbelievers broke through to the antennas? The Monolith had guided us, and the brothers noticed them just in time. One was eliminated immediately. The other two took to flight. Cowards. They’re all cowards. Only true faith leaves no room for fear! Two managed to escape, but the Monolith is wise and omniscient. He needs them alive, then.
On those who got to the antennas

Brothers, the Monolith called me last night. I spoke with him. He was awesome in his greatness. I nearly went blind, but his light filled me with great power! I know, I feel his power is present within all of us! He told me that only firm faith can overcome evil. He told me his power can fill only those who have faith. He revealed to me that our victory is at hand!
On the Monolith in dreams

Brothers, the Monolith tested my faith, and I nearly wandered from the track. But I withstood! Glory to the Monolith! His trials strengthen us! We were on our way back from the Dark Valley, and I fell a little behind my brothers. Evil grabbed the opportunity and started flirting with me. And… I doubted. The true images became distorted; the enemy was whispering in my ear that the Monolith uses us as slaves. But then it hit me: it’s a trial! I remembered the glory and the radiance of the Monolith, and regained my willpower and my confidence. Since then I have no fear of any trials and know no doubts. Glory to the Monolith!
On the test of faith.

I was in the Dark Valley. That place is rich in disbelievers, but the power of the Monolith hasn’t reached them yet. We were guarding. At night we were attacked. We fought against those beasts fiercely. My brothers’ accomplishments were numerous: the Monolith called them to him. But he had yet another trial for me. My gun couldn’t shoot any more. And then the Monolith spoke to me: “You are with me, and my power abides with you. Stand strong in your faith, and you will defeat my enemies and come close to me!” And then I turned into shadow. I bent down and walked around them on their right. The dumb spies didn’t notice anything. They thought they had killed us all and were laughing at the void bodies of our brothers. But I was already behind their backs. And then the power of the Monolith hit forth from my hands. And that’s how he killed them all. I’m happy to serve you, the Perfect one!...
On the combat in the Dark Valley
On the creature in the hangar.

My partner and I had been keeping an eye on this research institute for a long time. Too bleak of a place it was. No animals around, no mutants. Except, whoever went in there, they all returned either scared to death, or gone bats, or never even returned from there at all. So we thought we’d give it a try and check it out ourselves. We left before dawn, and by the time we got there it was already bright daylight. Left the car on the road and walked to the edge of the forest. We stopped there, my partner stayed on the ground and I climbed up the tree with the optics to look around the area. So I climb up there and see the institute facilities, and they don’t look that desolate, the windows aren’t broken, a little grass in the yard, not up to your hips like in other places… By all appearances it looked as though the place was inhabited, but it was dead silent and not a single movement anywhere. Then suddenly a burst of fire broke out on the right; someone blazing away from a machine gun. So I zoom in there and see some stranger on the roof of one of the buildings, running to and fro like a coursed rat and firing away in all directions. I peered and peered but couldn’t make out who he was shooting at: he was all by himself. And then… it all started (short pause) It was all spread before my eyes. The subgun broke loose from his grip as if on its own… It’s like that bit of iron suddenly got wings!.. The stranger opened his mouth, probably yelled something, whipped up his knife and held it up. And then I saw – holy-moly – another knife hanging right in front of him! Just hanging there in the air pointing at him, and no one holding it. What happened next is best not be told before the night… That thing went shredding that stranger for about five minutes… Little by little, son of a bitch, a little stab here, another cut there… The wretch was soon bleeding all over… Then, when he was already staggering, his knife got kicked out of his hand too; then he was lifted up in the air and twisted one time and another… I’d never seen anything like it before, like he was a rag or something… I was soaked in sweat within a second… After that… No, I’m not going to tell… Anyway, after I caught my breath, I scrutinized the whole area for another five minutes. Hands shaking, optics all dripping wet with sweat… Not a single damn thing! Not in the regular range, not infrared, no-thing. When I climbed down, my partner looked at me, and changed his mind about asking questions. When we got back to the base, I was tanking up for about a week… Then, when I snapped out of it, I tried to ask people around, if they had heard anything like that before. But they kept giving me this strange look like I had gone mental or something. So that’s the thing…

Brothers, as we were patrolling the outskirts of the Dark Forest we came across an unfaithful loner. He was already on his way to conversion, that is why we didn’t kill him, but he was still half-way in his animal state… I know, the wise Monolith did it for all of us: once again he revealed to us the true countenance of our enemies. Now our faith is even stronger! It’s at hand, brothers!.. The victory over the disbelievers is at hand, when the Monolith fulfills our greatest desire! Those who are truly faithful to him will be drawn to him, to his glory, his greatness! We shall abide in his radiance forever!..
Transformation in the Black Forest
Horror at the research institute.

Anyway, here’s what this one friend of mine told me. His chief wakes him in the middle of the night, tells him to make a beeline for the lab, there’s some cargo there. My friend’s half asleep, doesn’t get a thing, what the heck is with this cargo? And the chief is like, did you drink too much GI spirit or something? There’s a fresh corpse on the table, dinner is served! Anyway, he goes to the table and sees SOMETHING… Now, he had seen all sorts of stiffs from the Zone: boiled, grilled and ripped apart, not to mention dozens of mutants… But the sight of that thing – gag a maggot! Anyway, at first glance it looked just like a human being, except the head was way out of proportion: huge and ribbed like a pumpkin. And the body, as if straight from the concentration camp, skin and bones. But that’s what he figured out afterwards, at first, he says, he only saw a medley of flesh all smeared with some orange-red smut, blood or something…. Those pricks sure didn’t spare their ammo. Ya know all they talk about duty… searching for anomalous objects, dang it… search my foot!.. My friend says it was a mishmash of a colander and a torn-up hot water bottle… and they obviously trampled on it with their shitkickers; not an object, but damn piece of meat in some black rags. So he worked his butt off the rest of the night and half of the morning. Turns out it was that very creature the locals had been calling the illusionist: black rags, stalker visions, the head about a yard around… You know what’s funny, what they thought was its face turned out to be the top of its head. No, it does have a face, but it’s tiny-winy: the winkers always shut and the nose the size of a pin, but the cake-hole as wide as a gate. Probably when he walked his head would always hang down, ‘cause there’s no strength to keep it up… a snip... And get what these creatures eat for lunch. Mushrooms! Damn mushrooms! You’ve all seen ‘em, the Zone’s full of mushrooms, so the old-timers swear these creatures squeeze the juice out of them. Stinking gourmets… You know what else he was hiding in this little baggy on his hip? Well? How would you know! Alright, it was dried brains. And you know who’s brain it was? The controllers’!..
Pathologist's supper.

We had this one retard tailing along… So we’re going our away, halting for a while to rest, and as soon as we do he drops on his butt chilling out. When it’s time to go he’d be the last one to lift his ass off the ground. Well, he chilled a bit too much… fell behind, and that’s when the controller got him – zap! – and brain gone. You greenhorns better nick this down. Any rustle, or some shady wind… Even if a bunny darts by… although, Lord forbid you should run into any of the local bunnies… Anyway, you have to stay alert every stinking second. Magazines and the grenades at hand, an itchy trigger finger on your gun. The moment you spot something, fire off half a clip right away; anything behind the bush – shoot at sight and then ask for credentials. That’s the basic training around here: it’s not about doing extra duty, but about kicking the bucket before you even fart! And about the controllers, now this is a separate story. Say, you burst a fire at the rustle, and drop down right away, that very second! On your back or face down, it doesn’t matter. The controller grabs you if he sees you, he needs to concentrate or something. While you’re meditating in the shade, listen with both ears for any rustle, if any scum is heading your way. You may quietly recharge your gun, take out your grenades… Anyway, if all is quiet, count till three and… Get your ass out of there! As far away as possible! Did you suck it in? You yardbirds… Guard yourselves every second, that’s the only way to survive…
An easy prey for a controller

You know I’ve been thinking… well, not really thinking, just had this idea… What if all this, all of this around here, is some sort of an experiment on people? You know, some little green men… Why not? It’s a version as good as the others… I wonder: if this is something like a training ground, exactly what are they breaking in here? Are they trying to see what artifacts we are most slobbering over? And what if the artifacts are some sort of bombs, eh? Now they’ve been dragged all over the world, to all sorts of laboratories, the rich have coughed up for them… Like, wow, cool stuff!.. Now that’s what I want… Bought some piece of shit under cover… paid through the nose… You know, all this “we’re the coolest” stuff, make everybody jealous, dorks… and someday it’ll all blast off!.. Think of it, man!.. Isn’t that something?.. Ooh!.. But actually, no one knows shit what it’s all about… Well maybe those who’ve been behind the radar, they could lay it out… Well, they may know something, but they sure can’t say a word except dribbling and mooing. Well, maybe that’s just the reason they’re all dribbling… Oh well… Can’t fight back these thoughts, you know… It’s all pretty sad…
Pitfalls

Alright… I remember you were asking me something last night, what was it… Ah, here it is. So you were wondering why it’s just our eggheads messing around in the Zone, and the foreigners wouldn’t show their noses in here though there’s probably enough stuff for thousands of Nobel prizes… So let me explain it to you point by point. First of all, what the heck do they need coming down here, when they can give a grant to our guys under the conditions that they’ll hand it to them on a silver plate? Second of all, they’ve actually been here themselves, and quite a bit of them, too. It’s just that in the last two years these gringos have been scared of going into the Zone… after this one major bummer. So now they stick to buying materials and information. They pay pretty well, so many loners work for them, and the looters, too… What, haven’t you heard about this story? C’mon! The whole Zone was on a rampage and here you are as if born yesterday. Anyway, there was a large expedition here. The scientist alone counted about thirty people from all over the world… all stars, you know, big shots and all that… They were all rigged out: so much money you could wipe your ass with it; heaps of equipment. Had a platoon guarding them, and a couple of our guides. So they all got onto screened APCs and took off. Well, what happened next… Came back about a week later… twelve people on a wreck of an APC. They got as far as the prickler by the Rotten forest, and there was an ambush waiting for them… the looters… Yeah… Those bastards couldn’t care less where you come from… Finished off almost everyone. Only three people managed to get across the border line, two stalkers and one egghead. That guy really went demented from all the impressions, so they sent him off to the nut-house. He’s now writing a book about the Zone. The stalkers weren’t that bad, thanks to the experience. Except… I guess they also lost it in their own way: one of them took off to the radar and vanished, the other one went back to the Big Land. And the rest were taken by the Zone. You heard about Station-thirty-two? That’s were they all got hit. At the start it was all quiet… well, pretty much within the norm… They’d be reading their meters, taking samples, poking their devices into the anomalies… And then they all started going nuts. All together. People slowly going off their trolly. Our stalker, the one that retired eventually, told me about it… Some would clapperclaw their necks, others would smash their heads on the wall, and some would just simply… gun in their mouth and… And then the beasts started streaming out on them. Those who were still sane barricaded themselves in the house. You get the picture, right? Night and all the local monsters outside, and people going nuts one after another inside. In short, in the morning those who still had it together somehow broke out of there. Went straight on, without any roads; even got caught on some anomalies…Got to the Rotten forest… But none of those who had been left behind have been found. They say loads of controllers were recorded in that area. That’s how it was… Since then no one goes anywhere near Station-thrity-two, and a gringo wouldn’t go into the Zone for anything…
The chronicles of egghead globalists.

So here’s what I wanted to tell you. When them Duty guys were capturing that illusionist, I was right there! And ended up in that area by pure acident! My car, you know, my “Niva”, had its right front wheel broken off: the bolts chopped off on some hummock. And not a single spare part in stock. Well, I cussed it out, and then I thought, why don’t I go to the plant, pick me up what I need. It was ‘bout half a mile, about thirty minutes walk both ways. Besides, I’d already been there before… All of a sudden, I seem them Duty! And not just a patrol, but about fifty of them! What the heck!.. So I bob down in the bushes right where I was standing. “If they saw me and go combing, that’ll be the end of me”, I though. Anyway, I’m lying low in some pit, holding my breath. All of a sudden I hear salvo and they start blazing away like crazy! Such blasts and firing, I’d only heard once in my life… the First base attack, old guys, remember? Anyway, I’m lying there, listening closely… and it all goes WHAM! BANG!.. Five minutes later all goes quiet and I don’t hear anybody walking my way. Well, I get my balls together and peep out through the binocs. Those guys are trailing out of the workshop… all mussy and dragging their dead and the illusionist on the tarpaulin… or the dregs of the illusionist… And disappear into the glen. Then I hear the sound of engines, and the sound dies away. I waited a little more, to make sure they’re all gone. And then I went inside. Well, the heck you’ll find something left after Duty! But I wanted to check it out anyway. Well, that was something! The walls were all pierced almost all the way through. The joists laying all over the floor, a piece of the roof crumbled down. Shells up to my knees, a real shooting ground. Blood, some scraps… Didn’t find anything useful though, well, two full jets and a machine gun crushed down by a joist so bad you couldn’t get it out… Needless to say I didn’t even think about the bolts… So I went back to my car, chewed the cud for a while, took one bolt off each of the other wheels… and went back on low gear… And what if I had come out there half an hour early? … Makes you think…
Duty illusion.

Yeah, so I got as far as Pripyat outskirts that time. Well, I though I’d look around first thing. Found the highest spot, this huge boiler-house with a chimney. I walk in there on tip-toes… seems alright, dust everywhere, no footprints… So I crawl into the fire-chamber and start clambering up the stairs inside the chimney. So I’m climbing up, and the soot is not even smudging, it’s all turned to stone. So I get to the top and peep out… Beautiful view! Half the city spread right there before my eyes! So I take out the binocs and look around… (small pause) Well, and then… I was about to climb down, when this thought darts through my head that I’d completely forgotten to check out what’s going on right under my nose! So I bend over slightly, look this way, and then the other… Holy shit! That would’ve been some mess! Some midget strolling around the courtyard! And I had almost climbed down! It’s a good thing he didn’t see me then. But I couldn’t knock him down either: AK hanging on my back, and the chimney way too narrow to stir in it. The ‘makarov’ under my arm a dud, it was about fifty yards, plus the height of the chimney… if I didn’t get him the first time, he’d do me in. So I’m sitting there, thinking. And watching what he’s up to. And he was up to something weird, I’m telling you. First he was rummaging in some pile of lumber, in a zingzang sort of way, rubbish flying left and right. And then suddenly he stood stockstill. Sort of listening to something. And then it all started. The garbage in that pile started stirring. The midget sprang back, stood up straight, put his hands to his head and twisted them somehow weird… and that rubbish all of a sudden goes flying at him! From everywhere!.. Bits of iron, bricks, ruberoid, tree branches… Covered him from top to toe. Damn shit, I thought, that wiped the kitty’s eye, won’t pee anywhere anymore… Not a bit! For about two seconds the rubbish lay still, and then all of a sudden goes splattering everywhere! There were some pipes, well those stuck right into the concrete fence. The dwarf stood there for about a minute, thought something to himself, then turned around and trotted inside the building. It took me a while to catch my breath. “Well, I thought, time to save my bacon”. Suddenly, I smell smoke. And then it starts getting hot. Holy shit! Someone made a fire down below! A minute later I couldn’t breathe anymore. Somehow I managed to climbed out to the edge of the chimney, but there was no platform or anything of the kind, so I just perched there dangling my feet… The smoke was really eating my eyes out, I was choking for air… anyway, I needed to get my ass out of there! Thank God I always have about forty yards of rope with me, just in case of dire need… a dire need it was indeed… Anyway, I folded the rope, it wasn’t too thick, barely fixed it to the chimney, tore my necktie in half, wrapped around my hands and started climbing down praying to all gods in heaven… With just one thought in my head: don’t let me fall down! No safety rope, nothing! The rope was really cutting into my hands… and sure enough, as bad luck would have it, it ended about five yards above the ground. Had to jump. I had no choice, did I? I went straight crashing down! I was lucky not to break a bone, though I did get quite a few bruises and sprained my right leg alright! At that moment I thought I had torn my ligament altogether. Well, I took off so fast I could’ve probably won a gold medal in racing…
Greyhound in Pripyat.

I didn’t even believe my eyes then. You know, I always thought, I’d seen some really beautiful girls, right? But this one… she was… Perfect. Yes. That’s it. Perfect. It felt as if the whole world around her was black and white, and all sort of blurry, but she was clear and colorful. And the way she moved! I hadn’t seen anything like that before. I mean, I had a lump in my throat. What does she have to do with all this science? What has she got to do in the Zone?.. That’s right, in the Zone. It was at the break of night… There’s this nine storied block of flats by the bus station. First something flashed by in the window on the first floor. So I unlock my AK right away, and suddenly see her coming out of the building… I nearly rubbed my eyes, I mean, you know you can expect anything from the Zone! Meanwhile, she comes my way. And I’m standing there like a moron, staring at her… but holding my gun ready, you know, out of habit… Then she noticed me… Smiled… Said hello… And I’m listening to her but not hearing what she says, just staring at her. She was wearing blue overalls, bright blue… but it wasn’t loose, almost like a catsuit… And her body was something amazing! And then I realize that I’m not even listening to what she says, just standing there and grinning from ear to ear… Turned out she was from the research group. Asked me if I could help her. Help her! I was ready to jump into an anomaly for her!.. She said she was studying the… whatchamacallit … Zone endemics. You know the plants that don’t grow anywhere but here. Said she had run off from security because she didn’t feel like she had free hand with them and came there all on her own. I don’t know. I believed her. So I agreed to help her, bring her some stuff. Two days later came back just as we had agreed. Nearly got knocked out about five times while gathering all that stuff for her. I’m walking there with this one thought in my head: I’m going to see her again! And nothing. I didn’t even see the house where I’d met here. So that’s my story… But you should’ve seen her! All glowing from the inside.
On man's loneliness.
